intro: Centaurea paniculata subsp. levantina, commonly known as the Levantine panicled centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats such as rocky soils and sandy areas. It is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant. Its botanical structure supports its role in pollination and ecological stability in its native environment.
